meanings.sent1: The cruel treatment of the animals in the movie embrutes them.
meanings.sent2: Living in the wild can sometimes embrute animals, making them more aggressive.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children tried to embrute their little brother by teaching him to growl like a bear.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to violence can embrute even the most gentle souls.
meanings.sent5: The dark magic of the forest seemed to embrute the once peaceful creatures within.

meanings.sent1: The harsh words spoken by the bully embrute the self-esteem of the victim.
meanings.sent2: The polluted waters can embrute the purity of the natural environment.
meanings.sent3: The lazy habits of the students embrute the quality of their work.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt politician's actions embrute the integrity of the government.
meanings.sent5: The negative influence of the toxic friend can embrute one's moral compass.
